para.text: These regulations apply to any of the following individuals when the individual is involved in patient care activities:
Acupuncturist;
Dental hygienist;
Dentist;
Electrologist;
Employee of a health care facility;
Employee of a health care professional;
Mortician;
Nurse;
Physician;
Physician assistant; and
Podiatrist.
These regulations apply to any health care facility or private professional office where a health care worker is involved in patient care activities.
In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Assisted living facility" has the meaning for assisted living program stated in Health-General Article, §19-1801, Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Day care center for adults" has the meaning stated in Health-General Article, §14-301, Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Freestanding birthing center" has the meaning stated in Health-General Article, §19-3B-01, Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Freestanding medical facility" has the meaning stated in Health-General Article, §19-3A-01, Annotated Code of Maryland.
Health Care Facility.
"Health care facility" means a location where health care is provided, including:
Assisted living facility;
Day care center for adults;
Freestanding birthing center;
Freestanding medical facility;
Health maintenance organization;
Hospital;
Managed care organization;
Nursing home; and
Related institution.
"Health care facility" does not include a private professional office.
"Health care professional" means an individual who is licensed or certified under one or more of the following titles of Health Occupations Article, Annotated Code of Maryland:
Title 4 Dentistry;
Title 6 Electrologists;
Title 7 Morticians;
Title 8 Nurses;
Title 14 Physicians;
Title 15 Physician Assistants; and
Title 16 Podiatrists.
"Health care worker" means an individual who is:
A health care professional;
An employee of a health care professional; or
An employee of a health care facility.
"Health maintenance organization" has the meaning stated in Health-General Article, §19-701, Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Hospital" has the meaning stated in Health-General Article, §19-301, Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Managed care organization" has the meaning stated in Health-General Article, §15-101, Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Nursing home" means either:
A comprehensive care facility, as defined in COMAR 10.07.02.01B(6); or
An extended care facility, as defined in COMAR 10.07.02.01B(12).
"Patient care activity" means an action performed by a health care worker for a patient which could result in one or more of the following:
Blood or body fluids of the patient touching non-intact skin or mucous membrane of the health care worker;
Blood or body fluids of the health care worker touching nonintact skin or mucous membrane of the patient;
Percutaneous contact of the health care worker with the blood or body fluids of the patient; or
Percutaneous contact of the patient with the blood or body fluids of the health care worker.
"Private professional office" means a location which is not a part of a health care facility where a health care professional provides services to the public on a regular basis.
"Related institution" has the meaning stated in Health-General Article, §19-301, Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Universal precautions" has the meaning stated in COMAR 10.06.01.02B(10).

section.heading: Compliance Requirements for an Individual.
section.text: An individual who is performing patient care activities shall:

para.text: Comply with the principles of universal precautions;
If necessary, make an emergency exception to the use of universal precautions in a situation when failure to provide immediate care could result in serious harm to or death of a patient; and
Comply with current professional standards of patient care with regard to disinfection and sterilization of reusable devices used in patient care procedures, including:
Prohibiting the reuse of single use needles; and
Properly disposing of needles and other sharps devices.

section.heading: Compliance Requirements for a Health Care Facility.

para.text: A health care facility shall:
Adopt, implement, and enforce a policy that:
Requires the use of universal precautions by medical staff and employees engaged in patient care activities,

Permits an individual to make an emergency exception to the use of universal precautions, at the individual's discretion, in a situation where failure to provide immediate care could result in serious harm to or death of a patient, and
Requires compliance with current professional standards of patient care with regard to disinfection and sterilization of reusable devices used in patient care procedures; and
Display the version of the notice "We Take Precautions for You" specified in Table A, shown in §B of this regulation, at the entrance to the health care facility.
Table A.

section.heading: Compliance Requirements for Health Care Professional with Private Professional Office.

para.text: A health care professional who practices in a private professional office shall:
Ensure that an individual who performs patient care services in the professional's office:
Complies with the principles of universal precautions,

Is permitted to make an emergency exception to the use of universal precautions, at the individual's discretion, in a situation where failure to provide immediate care could result in serious harm to or death of a patient, and
Complies with current professional standards of patient care with regard to disinfection and sterilization of reusable devices used in patient care procedures; and
Except as provided in §C of this regulation, display the version of the notice "We Take Precautions for You" specified in Table B shown in §B of this regulation.
Table B.
A health care professional not listed in Table B is not required to post the notice "We Take Precautions for You".
